intro: Calceolaria enneasperma, commonly known as the nine-seeded slipper orchid, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its unique, slipper-shaped calyx that resembles a small cup. The plant produces showy, violet to purple flowers that are often adorned with intricate patterns. Calceolaria enneasperma typically grows in high-altitude environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its ornamental value has made it a popular choice for gardeners seeking exotic and visually striking plants.
